text:
last n observations is straight-forward; for example:
# mean forecast
from numpy import mean
result = mean(history[-n:])
Listing 11.4: Example of averaging prior observations.
We may also want to test out the median in those cases where the distribution of observations
is non-Gaussian.
# median forecast
from numpy import median
result = median(history[-n:])
Listing 11.5: Example of calculating the median prior observations.
